Description: An oval stamp with a stallion in relief to left (right in an impression), with a foreleg raised and a long high-arched tail. At the rear is a pinched-in grip, pierced from side to side. The side view is reminiscent of a finger-ring of Ptolemaic shape. Solid; the design may have been carved, or formed by pressing into a mould. Abrasions and wear in many areas. Orange-brown Nile silt with many white inclusions; buff-brown surface. The face is varnished, presumably in modern times.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. From the Fayum. Ptolemaic, third or second century BC.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3603)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
